Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2014 03:30PM lv2crft wrote: Ceharman said, "its harder if i have to think about it, talk about it, explain it to someone my parents may have asked for prayers from. Denial is a comfortable place in the waiting game."  That's where I am right now:  I try to distract myself as much as possible with knitting, crocheting, good detective videos, playing my violin, hugging my rabbit, etc. Mega-jubilations for you that your findings were benign!  I'd imagine it'd feel like a sort of rebirth.

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2014 04:14PM lv2crft wrote: Thanx to all 4 of you for your replies!    I never knew there were wig liners, and the satin pillowcase sounds luscious, LOL!  Around the house, I would definitely go "commando" (new expression for me, LOL!), and that hint about the lint roller cracked me up:  I have plenty of those for my rabbit, since he sheds excessively for weeks at a time about 3x/year. Appreciatively, L2C
Posts.Title: Scalp Sensitivity? lv2crft lv2crft

Posts.Content: lv2crft wrote: Howdy! I've been diagnosed with IDC and have to get chemo, radiation & surgery.  I've already got some wigs (thanx to my mother's generosity a couple of years back, when we had no idea I'd be getting cancer), but I'd like to know, please, what you gals' experiences have been in terms of pain, discomfort, rash, etc. on the scalp during chemo.  I already found wigs uncomfortable WITH all my hair still there  (prickly, itchy, too tight, hot), so I'm wondering if it's even realistic for me to consider wearing a wig, or if I should just limit myself to turbans. Thanx in advance for any input on this! Posts.Content: lv2crft wrote: Howdy! I'm a newbie, and couldn't find the place you're supposed to introduce yourself (is there one?), so I hope I'm not being rude, "jumping right in" with 2 questions. I'm 3 months shy of 59, and just got back mammo and ult.sd. results:  I already knew from self-exams that I had a lump in my left breast, but only after I got home today did I find the lump in my lymph node area (quite deep in at the lower end of the underarm).  I only found this bec. the u.s. results indicated "lymph node involvement." My first question is:  has anyone ever heard of whether a lymph node in this kind of situation could be swollen yet not malignant?  Because if it is malignant, then evidently (from what I've been able to gather from research so far) it's metastatic b.c. which means bigtime trouble up ahead, even after I get the breast removed and the lump excised. My other question is:  does anyone know whether painful lymph nodes are a definite sign of cancer in them (bec. I have pain there off and on, though fortunately not excruciating)? I have an MRI-biopsy (90 min. of lying on your stomach!!!! Gonna do wonders for my bad neck and bad back!) Thursday in a week, but I'm trying to get a jump start on the big picture, so I can start planning (planning makes me feel a bit less threatened {snort}). Thanx in advance for any input!  (I'm posing both questions to cover the field thoroughly.)
